page.title: 15CREMATION AT ST JOHNS
page.content: Woking Crematorium was 100 years old in March this year. At first there were only about 3 cremations a year but now there are 2000. The chapel, which was built in 1888 costing Â£3000, has a fine catafalque, where the coffin rests before it is burnt. It is made of marble and brass. There is also a stained glass window depicting St Francis of Assisi. In a small room next to the chapel are the ashes of many people in urns. They are kept in holes in the wall called nitches. In the Chapel of Remembrance, which lies in a quiet corner of the garden, are holders for flowers and a Book of Remembrance in which names are written The pages are turned to the corresponding date. The gardens are beautiful with plaques bearing names of the dead placed before a plant or tree. There is abundant wildlife.
